item.title: "Take Stock Of Policies Inciting Hatred": Russia To US After Trump Attack
item.description: Moscow called on the United States Sunday to "take stock" of its "policies of incitement to hatred", while using the assassination attempt on former president Donald Trump to denounce support for Ukraine.

item.title: Donald Trump's Security To Be Boosted After Shooting At Pennsylvania RallyD
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign team has announced plans to bolster security protocols to ensure his safety after the former US president was injured in a shooting incident at an election rally in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Republicans Blame 'Biden's Rhetoric' After Trump Assassination Attempt
item.description: The shooting at an election rally in Pennsylvania's Butler last evening has left former US President Donald Trump injured and the Joe Biden administration red-faced

item.title: "No Place For Violence": World Leaders Condemn Attack On Donald Trump
item.description: Several world leaders have condemned the shooting at Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania, in which the former US President was shot in the upper part of the ear.

item.title: Who Was Thomas Matthew Crooks, Man Who Tried To Assassinate Donald Trump
item.description: The FBI has identified the shooter in the assassination attempt on former president Donald Trump as 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks.

item.title: Purses Barred, 2-Hour Long Checks: Woman At Trump Rally Describes Security
item.description: Those who attended Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania last night -- and were witnesses to a shocking assassination attempt -- were not allowed to carry purses and security checks took nearly two hours, a woman who was at the gathering has said

item.title: Thomas Matthew Crooks, 20, Identified As Trump Rally Shooter
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has identified Thomas Matthew Crooks as the shooter behind the attempted assassination of former US President Donald Trump, it said in a statement on Sunday.

item.title: "Shocked": Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai Condemn Attack On Trump At US Rally
item.description: Big Tech leaders on Sunday condemned an assassination attempt aimed at former US President Donald Trump during an election rally, stressing that political violence is intolerable.

item.title: On Donald Trump Rally Shooter's Motive, FBI Gives An Update
item.description: Security agencies in the US have identified the shooter behind the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump as 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks, but are yet to share details on the motive behind the crime.

item.description:

item.title: ‘A mixed bag’ NATO conference ‘hasn’t cured the problem’ for Dems’ confidence in Biden: Peter Baker - MSNBC
item.description:
1. ‘A mixed bag’ NATO conference ‘hasn’t cured the problem’ for Dems’ confidence in Biden: Peter Baker  MSNBC
  2. How America's allies are trying to 'Trump-proof' Nato's future  BBC.com
  3. Biden leans on foreign policy to justify remaining Democrat nominee: Here's what he's done  Fox News
  4. Key takeaways from Biden’s NATO news conference: gaffes and defiance  Al Jazeera English
  5. At 75, NATO has forgotten its purpose  The Hill

item.title: Trump rally shooting: FBI names Thomas Matthew Crooks, 20, as ‘subject involved’
item.description:
Suspect was shot dead after assassination attempt on the former president at a campaign rally

  • Follow live updates

The Federal Bureau of Investigation has identified 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks from Bethel Park, Pennsylvania as the “subject involved” in the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, it said in a statement on Sunday.

The shooting took place during a campaign rally at the Butler Park Showgrounds in Pennsylvania on Saturday evening.

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump rally shooting live: FBI names ‘subject involved’ after suspect shot dead in assassination attempt
item.description:
Thomas Matthew Crooks, aged 20, named as person involved in shooting at Butler Park Showgrounds in Pennsylvania on Saturday evening

  • Trump rally shooting being investigated as attempt on his life as spectator killed
  • ‘There was clearly blood’: eyewitness
  • What we know so far

Pennsylvania’s Democratic governor Josh Shapiro rejected political violence in a statement posted on X following the apparent shooting of Donald Trump at a rally in his state today:

Trump spokesperson Steven Cheung tells me in a statement that the former president is being assessed at a local medial facility:

Continue reading...

item.title: Move by some NATO members to let Kyiv strike Russia with their arms is a dangerous escalation, Kremlin says
